page.title: 04STARRICKS FARM (CONT)
page.content: After this is done it is put in barns to sweat and dry out, ready for the cows to eat during the winter.In summer the cows eat grass on the pastures. On average a cow can eat ninety bales of hay throughout the winter. At the bottom of the farm there is a railway line with a bridge over it. This bridge makes it quite difficult for large vehicles to pass over because of the sharp bend that leads up to it. Most of the farms that are in this area are dairy producing farms. About three of them are in a small valley, but Starricks farm is high up on a hill. From this point you can see Inglebourgh, parts of the Lake District and on a clear day you can see the lighthouse flashing on Walney Island.
